poem:
### Trial of the Earth

In the court's crucible, defenders stand,
Voices muzzled, eyes unbowed,
Forests whisper their truths,
Oceans weep in silent witness.
Yet the chains rattle louder,
Steel against skin, within these walls.
Verdicts like storm clouds gather—
Who judges the wind and rain?
Hearts of stone sentence the green.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
